intro: Matelea elachyantha, commonly known as the pale-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and the plant has a woody stem that becomes more branched with age. Matelea elachyantha is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
